content: No, Victor Hugo was not the first author to explore the themes of social injustice and corruption in literature. These themes have been explored in literature throughout history by many different authors. However, Hugo was one of the most influential writers of his time in addressing these issues, and his works had a significant impact on social and political movements in France and around the world. He was also known for his vivid and powerful depictions of social inequality and his commitment to social justice, which helped to inspire later generations of writers and activists.
